title: CORS response headers not present with quarkus.http.non-application-root-path
body:
### Describe the bug

When using `quarkus.http.root-path` and `quarkus.http.non-application-root-path` to customize the location of REST endpoints (not `/`), but keeping the non-application endpoints (`/openapi`, etc.) available at `/q`, the CORS filter is not executed for the non-application endpoint calls.

Example config:
```
quarkus.http.cors=true
quarkus.http.root-path=/api
quarkus.http.non-application-root-path=/q
```

Making an HTTP request to `/api/hello` will return CORS response headers;  a request to `/q/openapi` will not.

If the non-application root path is changed to not have a leading `/`, then the CORS headers are available, but the `q` path is now available at `/api/q`.

### Expected behavior

CORS headers should be available (when CORS enabled and Origin header present in requests) for non-application endpoints if the root path has been customized.

### Actual behavior

No CORS headers are present.

### How to Reproduce?

[code-with-quarkus.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/8958794/code-with-quarkus.zip)

1. Run in dev mode (./mvnw clean compile quarkus:dev)
2. `curl --head -H "Origin: https://www.google.com" localhost:8080/api/hello`
3. Note the response has the `access-control-allow-origin` and `access-control-allow-credentials` headers
4. `curl --head -H "Origin: https://www.google.com" localhost:8080/q/openapi`
5. Note the response does not have and CORS related headers returned
6. Change `quarkus.http.non-application-root-path` to `q`
7. Repeat step 2, note same results as step 3
8. `curl --head -H "Origin: https://www.google.com" localhost:8080/api/q/openapi`
9. Note the CORS headers are present in the response
